alert.note: Alert for Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 24 at 2:52AM PDT until March 24 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph over exposed terrain. * WHERE...Portions of Highway 97 through northern Klamath County and portions of Highway 140 in eastern Klamath County and western Lake County and including the cities of Chemult, Crescent, Sprague River, and Beatty. * WHEN...Until 5 PM PDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County
